name: "Moving" Dramas Multiple Choice Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Flight to Freedom" was an interesting movie that was said to be loosely based on this pilot's real-life adventure.
questions.explanation:
Amelia Earhart.

	Rosalind Russell starred as a prominent female pilot. In the movie, she performs undercover work for the U.S. on the eve of WW II. The movie fueled speculation that Earhart's disappearance was somehow connected with espionage activities in which she may have been engaged.

questions.text: "The Spirit of St. Louis" was, of course, about Charles Lindbergh. Who played Lindy?
questions.explanation:
James Stewart.

	Stewart played the "lone eagle".

questions.text: "The High and the Mighty" was an early airplane-in-trouble movie. Who was one of the stars?
questions.explanation:
John Wayne.

	John Wayne didn't only make westerns. This one was pretty good.

questions.text: "The Flight of the Phoenix" involved a plane that lands in dangerous terrain. Where did it land?
questions.explanation:
Desert.

	James Stewart as a pilot who lands the plane in the Sahara Desert. He doesn't play his usual "nice guy" in this one.

questions.text: "Narrow Margin" originally starred Charles McGraw and Marie Windsor. It was re-made with Gene Hackman as the star. Who played the female lead?
questions.explanation:
Anne Archer.

	The original wasn't bad. The newer version made some changes (of course) - but also made for an entertaining adventure story.

questions.text: "Murder on the Orient Express" (1974) was a Hercule Poirot detective story. Who played Poirot?
questions.explanation:
Albert Finney.

	From the work by Agatha Christie. In my opinion, a truly dreadful movie - with comic book characters and a silly, unbelievable ending.

questions.text: "The Wayward Bus" was based on a work by what author?
questions.explanation:
John Steinbeck.

	Not one of his best known works.

questions.text: "Ship of Fools" was based on a popular novel by what author?
questions.explanation:
Katherine Anne Porter.

	Probably Porter's best known work.

questions.text: "The Caine Mutiny" included all of the following in the cast EXCEPT:
questions.explanation:
John Garfield.

	Johnson is the principal antagonist against Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). MacMurray is the instigator who chickens out when the going gets rough. Ferrer is the attorney for Johnson.

questions.text: "Deliverance" featured a different form of transportation: canoes. Which of the following did NOT survive the trip?
questions.explanation:
Ronny Cox.

	Cox is shot early in the movie and disappears into the river. Beatty is abused and Voight is terrified, but they survive. Reynolds receives a significant injury, but survives.
